10.author: story, Bill Jemas & Brian Michael Bendis ; script, Brian Michael Bendis ; pencils, Mark Bagley ; inks, Art Thibert & Dan Panosian.
notes: ca. 180 p. : col. ill. ; 26 cm.
(Ultimate Spider-Man ; v. 1)
Contains material originally published in magazine form as Ultimate Spider-Man, #1-7.

Summary (from OCLC): "Ultimate Spider-Man" is the reinterpretation of Spider-Man's origin, updated for today's teens. Starting over at the beginning, the story of how a tortured teen is imbued with startling powers has been completely reimagined to appeal to the high-tech, media savvy youth of today.

92.title: Power Company
92.author: script, Kurt Busiek ; pencils, Tom Grummett ; inks, Prentis Rollins ; colors, Alex Sinclair ; letters, Comicraft
92.appears_in: 22 p. in The Power Company, no. 9 (Dec. 2002).
notes: Summary: The team gathers around the comatose Josiah Power and reviews how the activities of the prior day played out. Manhunter looks at how he, Striker Z and Green Arrow bested Biomax. Skyrocket goes over how she, Bork and Sapphire were bested by The Cadre and Doctor Polaris. This leads to a junior partners meeting which Josiah cools down. The hospital scene ends with the team pledging to find the person who shot Josiah, only to have Lt. Driver deflate the moment by telling them that the shooter has already been caught by the police.
Data from John Greb, Gregg Whitmore and Peter Croome via Grand Comics Database.

97.title: Power Company
97.author: script, Kurt Busiek ; pencils, Tom Grummett ; inks, Prentis Rollins, Al Vey, Wade Von Grawbadger ; colors, Rob Ro ; letters, Comicraft
97.appears_in: 22 p. in The Power Company, no. 14 (May 2003).
notes: Cover title: "Fatal Attraction."

Summary: Dr. Polaris and his Cadre have defeated the Power Company and manage to hold the Justice League at by as Polaris focuses on magnetically mind-wiping the entire planet. His Cadre betrays him and, working together, the Power Company takes the Doctor down.
Data from John Greb and Gregg Whitmore via Grand Comics Database.

98.title: Power Company
98.author: script, Kurt Busiek ; pencils, Tom Grummett ; inks, Prentis Rollins, Al Vey ; colors, Rob Ro, Alex Bleyaert ; letters, Comicraft.

physical description.totalPages: 21 p. in The Power Company, no. 16 (July 2003).

notes: Summary: It's a busy few weeks for the Company. Bork and Firestorm quit the business, Witchfire takes a leave of absence, Garrison Slate and the other partners look at new options for generating money for the company, and the team is trapped in another dimension after being duped by one of Dr. Cyber's henchwomen.
Appearance of the Haunted Tank.
Data from John Greb and Gregg Whitmore via Grand Comics Database.

99.title: Power Company
99.author: script, Kurt Busiek ; pencils, Tom Grummett ; inks, Prentis Rollins ; colors, Alex Bleyaert ; letters, Comicraft
99.appears_in: 22 p. in The Power Company, no. 17 (Aug. 2003).
notes: Cover title: "The Art of War!"

Summary: As four members of the Power Company try to survive on the planet where they've been trapped, Josiah, Witchfire, Bork and Lt. Jen Stewart, in Star Labs' cybertank, decide a rescue mission is on order. Meanwhile several businesses are merging with Inter-sect, which is secretly run by Dr. Cyber and Nyi'tarla (who comes from the planet the Company is stranded on.
Data from John Greb and Gregg Whitmore via Grand Comics Database.

100.title: Power Company
100.author: script, Kurt Busiek ; pencils, Tom Grummett ; inks, Wade Von Grawbadger ; colors, Alex Bleyaert ; letters, Comicraft
100.appears_in: 22 p. in The Power Company, no. 18 (Sept. 2003).
notes: Cover title: "Finale."
Summary: As the dragon riders invade Earth and infiltrate the Captains of Industry, the only hope lies with the Power Company who fight the meance from its home dimension.

104.heading: The Power Cosmic.
104.title: The Final Doom
104.author: writer, Tom DeFalco ; artist, Ron Lim.
notes: 1 v. : col. ill. ; 26 cm.
(Fantastic Five)

"As Doctor Doom embarks on a quest for world domination, only the Fantastic Five stand in his way. Can the heroes triumph over their greatest enemy, even when he regains the Power Cosmic? Plus, when the Human Torch thinks about leaving the F5, will the team ever be the same?"
"Collecting Fantastic Five #1-5."

105.heading: The Power Cosmic.
105.title: Silver Surfer
105.author: writer, Mike Carey ; art, Pasqual Ferry ; colors, Justin Ponsor ; letters, Virtual Calligraphy's Rus Wooton.
notes: 1 v. : col. ill. ; 26 cm.
(Ultimate Fantastic Four ; v. 9)
"Contains material originally published in magazine form as Ultimate Fantastic Four #42-46."

Summary (from SkyRiver): In an attempt to harness the power of the cosmic cube, young scientist Reed Richards has pierced the barriers of a hundred universes, and falling through the opening into our unsuspecting reality is the keeper of the power cosmic: the Silver Surfer.

106.heading: Power Crystals.
106.title: Avenging Angel.
106.author: [No author]
notes: (Starblazer ; no. 24)

Begins: "Joe 'Acer' Angel earned his nickname during the Galactic War. Acer flew his AK-40 Angel Fighter non-stop from Earth in an attempt to halt the advance of the hated Arkan warmongers. Although the Galactic Federation controlled all the supplies of the power crystal Trypzium, somehow the Arkans were buying it to fuel their war-machines. And if the sellers couldn't be found, it could mean the end of the Federation."

107.heading: Power Crystals.
107.title: Superman Returns : an Earthquake in Metropolis!
107.author: by David E
notes: 1 v. : col. ill. ; 23 cm.
"Official movie book".
Summary (from OCLC): Superman has to save the day once more when Lex Luthor uses the power crystal from Superman's Fortress of Solitude to cause an earthquake in Metropolis.
Superhero fiction.

108.heading: Power Demands.
108.title: "I Find It Very Shortsighted of Our Adjoining States to Not Have Anticipated Our Power Demand"
108.author: by Ralph Dunagin.
notes: Summary: A couple is by a pool, with wine, palm trees and California architecture.

109.title: "Power Dive"
109.author: by Russell Keaton
109.appears_in: 1 p. in Reg'lar Fellers Heroic Comics, no. 9 (Nov. 1941).
notes: Three of four in this issue.
Includes a panel of Flyin' Jenny paper dolls.

110.title: Power Down
110.author: Brian K
110.appears_in: Vaughan, writer ; Tony Harris, pencils ; Jim Clark, inks ; JD Mettler, colors ; Jared K. Fletcher, letters.
notes: 1 v. : col. ill. ; 26 cm.
(Ex Machina ; bk. 6)
Originally published in single magazine form as Ex Machina #26-29.

Summary (from SkyRiver): Mitchell Hundred, mayor of New York City, faces his most difficult challenge to date, handling the massive 2003 blackout. But what secret connection does Mitchell have to this devastating event?

114.title: Power Comics
notes:
Undated anthology-style comic book in
        the adventure story genres (detective, western, superhero, and
        spy stories). Grand Comics Database "inferred" dates are June
        through Sept. 1945
